title: Question 5
prompt:
After the Prefect calls Dupin’s ideas odd, the excerpt says: “‘Very true,’ said Dupin, as he supplied his visitor with a pipe, and rolled towards him a comfortable chair.” What characteristic of Dupin does this show?

Dupin is
description: Click the <u>one best answer</u> to each question.
feedback:
The Prefect’s comment, calling Dupin “odd,” might be taken as offensive by a thin-skinned person. Dupin, though, simply agrees with the statement and offers the Prefect a pipe and a comfortable chair. He is not offended.


“That is another of your odd notions,” said the Prefect, who had a fashion of calling every thing “odd” that was beyond his comprehension, and thus lived amid an absolute legion of “oddities.”

“Very true,” said Dupin, as he supplied his visitor with a pipe, and rolled towards him a comfortable chair.
